Package ca.yapper.yapperapp.Databases

Class UserDatabase

java.lang.Object
ca.yapper.yapperapp.Databases.UserDatabase
public class UserDatabase extends Object
Class holding all the user class related functions that interact with the database.

  • Method Details

    • setFirestoreInstance

      public static void setFirestoreInstance(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore firestore)

    • loadUserFromDatabase

      public static void loadUserFromDatabase(String userDeviceId, EntrantDatabase.OnUserLoadedListener listener)
      Loads a User from Firestore using the specified device ID and provides the result through the provided listener.
      Parameters:
      userDeviceId - The unique device ID of the user to be loaded.
      listener - The listener to handle success or error when loading the user.

    • createUserInDatabase

      public static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<User> createUserInDatabase(String deviceId, String email, boolean isAdmin, boolean isEntrant, boolean isOrganizer, String name, String phoneNum, boolean isOptedOut)
      Creates a new user entry in Firestore with the provided details.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The unique device ID of the user.
      email - The email address of the user.
      isAdmin - True if the user has admin privileges.
      isEntrant - True if the user has entrant privileges.
      isOrganizer - True if the user has organizer privileges.
      name - The name of the user.
      phoneNum - The phone number of the user.
      isOptedOut - True if the user has opted out of notifications.
      Returns:
      The created User instance.

    • addMissedOutEventsSubcollection

      private static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> addMissedOutEventsSubcollection(String userDeviceId)
      This function adds user specific events that are missed out to the users corresponding subcollection
      Parameters:
      userDeviceId - The device ID of the user.
      Returns:
      a task that adds all the missed out events then completes, otherwise it fails.

    • validateUserInputs

      public static void validateUserInputs(String deviceId, String email, String name)
      This function provides user input validation, for the device id, email and name.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The Id for users device.
      email - The user profile email
      name - The user profile name

    • createUserObject

      public static User createUserObject(String deviceId, String email, boolean isAdmin, boolean isEntrant, boolean isOrganizer, String name, String phoneNum, boolean isOptedOut)
      This function creates a user object using the given data.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The Id for users device.
      email - The user profile email
      isAdmin - Boolean for checking if the user has the admin role
      isEntrant - Boolean for checking if the user has the entrant role
      isOrganizer - Boolean for checking if the user has the organizer role
      name - The user profile name
      phoneNum - The user profile phone number
      isOptedOut - The user status on recieving notifcations. (True means they don't want to recieve any notifications)
      Returns:
      a new user object created from the given data

    • prepareUserData

      public static Map<String,Object> prepareUserData(User user)
      This function obtains user data from a user object and converts it into a map of the data
      Parameters:
      user - a user object
      Returns:
      a map of the users data

    • saveUserToFirestore

      private static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<User> saveUserToFirestore(String deviceId, User user, Map<String,Object> userData)
      This function takes user data and saves it to the FireStore database
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The Id for users device.
      user - a user object
      userData - A map of the users data
      Returns:
      a task that saves the user data to the database and completes, otherwise we recieve an error on failure

    • updateUserField

      public static void updateUserField(String deviceId, String field, Object fieldContents, EntrantDatabase.OnFieldUpdateListener listener)
      This function updates a given field in the users document in the database.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The Id for users device.
      field - name of the field we want to update
      fieldContents - the value we want to change the chosen field to
      listener - handles the outcome of the operation

    • validateFieldValue

      public static boolean validateFieldValue(String field, Object value)
      This function is for validating a field value
      Parameters:
      field - name of the field we want to validate
      value - the value we are validating
      Returns:
      returns true if the value in the field is valid

    • isValidEmail

      public static boolean isValidEmail(String email)
      Checks if the given email is valid
      Parameters:
      email - the users email
      Returns:
      true if email is a valid format

    • isValidPhone

      public static boolean isValidPhone(String phone)
      Checks if the given phone is valid
      Parameters:
      phone - the users phone number
      Returns:
      true if phone is a valid format

    • isValidField

      private static boolean isValidField(String field)
      Checks if the users profile fields are valid
      Parameters:
      field - a given field
      Returns:
      true if the given field is a user profile valid

    • checkIfUserIsAdmin

      public static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> checkIfUserIsAdmin(String deviceId)
      Checks if a user is an admin based on their device ID.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The device ID of the user.
      Returns:
      A Task that resolves to true if the user is an admin, false otherwise.

    • saveLocationToFirestore

      public static void saveLocationToFirestore(String eventId, String userDeviceId, double latitude, double longitude, UserDatabase.OnLocationSavedListener listener)
      This function saves the users location to the database, for a given event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.
      userDeviceId - The device ID of the user.
      latitude - The users latitude
      longitude - The users longitude
      listener - Listener to handle the outcome of saving the location
